WRITING.TEXT: Very good at finding lost drunk people I guess :)
No I suck, I am still preparing prints haha. Super soon, set the alarm for 2 more days :D

Thank you, The sketchbook I'm using is sort of brandless, it's just some Swedish paper companies random black sketchbook. Can't get it out side of Sweden. (Last time I needed new sketchbooks my sister had to send them to Japan for me) :)
Thank you, and yes, this is as pure as it gets for me. I have a website but not much is happening on it. However for these drawings I use instagram: https://www.instagram.com/thedeadpigeon/
Thank you :)
Thanks :D
Thank you!

Thank you! These drawings that I do are almost always for nothing in particular. They are just something I do in the morning, for some sort of meditation I guess :P When Im at work I draw completely other stuff for tattoos.
I did this a couple of days ago but as its Friday the 13th today I thought it was in someway suitable. :)

WRITING.TITLE: Captain Ghost Boat, Copics Ink, A4

WRITING.TEXT: Thank you! I draw whatever comes to mind. A lot comes to mind.
Mostly I tattoo random things, whatever the customer wants pretty much. I rarely get to tattoo my own style here :/
Well I have this 10$ air moisturizer here, you can try that ;)
Haha no, I have never seen that movie.
Pretty much!

I am extremely specific about what materials I need to use for this particular style. If I am going to keep this up this is they way they need to be done. I have so many high quality sketchbooks laying around with only 2-3 pages drawn in them before throwing them in a box. I found my great grandfathers sketchbook that is over 100 years old with lesser quality then mine and it still looked okay, just aged and cool :)
Well thats a huge compliment

Thank you, being a tattoo artist in Tokyo is like being a tattoo artist in any other country except that you have weird regulations looming over you. Its hard to get materials and all kinds of other stuff that makes your everyday life harder.
Thank you :)
Nope I just draw and then color it in, I guess it needs to be the right combination of paper, pen and colour. The paper I am using is nothing special and hard to get. Can only buy it in Sweden.

Thank you, I studied graphic design for a couple of years and took some advanced drawing classes but that was just painting nude people haha. Drawing is something I have been doing as far as I can remember. New prints will be available soonish, Within this month.
I have been tattooing for 7 years ;)
Thank you, Im glad that you enjoy it
Thanks man!
Yes this is banana skeleton guy haha, Thank you.
Thank you for appreciating it :)
Haha awesome man! Ill be waiting :)
Yes as all their artwork is my stuff ;)
yes ;)
Thank you :) Well, if you make something cool you shouldn't give it away for free on the internet I think. uploading a straight full resolution picture is sort of giving it away.
Thank you
Pretty close to be honest, almost weirdly close haha.
Haha thank you! That is some trust right there :)
Hello and thank you, yes I am a tattoo artist and here you go: https://www.instagram.com/thedeadpigeon/ https://www.instagram.com/deadpigeontattoo/
Here you go :) https://www.instagram.com/thedeadpigeon/ http://www.deadpigeon.se
haha no you can't :)
Hello and thank you :) I don't take any requests at the moment, I only sell prints but I am about to change what is available in my print shop for 2017.
I just unpublished it yesterday because I wanted to change it around. I am thinking about changing suppliers as well.
Thank you, Copic markers mostly
Not sure to be honest
Thank you :) I have my instagram @thedeadpigeon and my webpage: deadpigeon.se
Hrligt, tack :)
Just a coincidence
Thank you! Around 3-5 hours I guess, Sometimes faster. I have a bunch of timelapses but havent uploaded them.
Haha, hey and thank you :)
Thank you!
Thank you:)
Not allowed to say, you must first do the blueberrie test.
You can have a look at @deadpigeontattoo on instagram
I like how they blend and the inkflow, that's about it ;)
Thank you! You can have a look at @deadpigeontattoo on instagram, I have a few in my style there.
Haha I have no problem drawing hands ;)
Haha I'll be waiting
Hello, Thank you! It's the markers
I'm not allowed to say
Haha That must have sucked and thank you :)
But wait! For this specific picture I redid it once and used a light table to get the skeletons symetrical.

Hello, no I just start directly with a ballpoint pen when doing this style, thats why the drawing turns out weirdly clean on the paper. Recently I however have started sketching down ideas on a ipad pro just to remember them for another day. But when I draw other stuff, more traditional stuff for tattoos and such, I always sketch them out.

I do these for pure fun, I just love drawing like this and it's very therapeutical for me. Sure I do sell prints but I almost loose money from that haha. My profession is tattooing but what I tattoo and these drawings are very different. It's extremly hard to make a living from just drawing.
